item.title: Ehh title can't explain my problem, CLICK HERE
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

You have to change the algorithm: int modY = absY > 6400 ? absY - 6400 : absY; wildLevel = (((modY - 3520) / 8) + 1);

Everyone else just changes what it says, but not the true level.

Read full topic

item.title: Ehh title can't explain my problem, CLICK HERE
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

No… What are you trying to do?
Make a wilderness spot out of the wilderness? That’s easy.

Create a new boolean or whatever and name it anything, here’s a suggestion:

public boolean inModifiedWild() { if((absX > 2586 && absX < 2622 && absY > 3867 && absY < 3894) || (absX > 3200 && absX < 3270 && absY > 9285 && absY < 9340) || (absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 3518 && absY < 3966)) { return true; } return false; }

Now go into Client.java (server sided obviously) and search for:

} else if (inDuelArena()) { getPA().walkableInterface(201); if(duelStatus == 5) { getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1); } else { getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Challenge", 1); }

Right under that, add this:

} else if (inModifiedWild()) { getPA().walkableInterface(197); getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: 1", 199); getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1);

I’m assuming your using PI.

You can change ‘Level: 1’ to whatever you want it to say.

Good luck.

Read full topic
item.source: Ehh title can't explain my problem, CLICK HERE

item.title: Ehh title can't explain my problem, CLICK HERE
item.dc:creator: @lugmfr lugmfr
item.description:
@lugmfr wrote:

Okay, it’s -77 wild as you see, yes I edited it.

I want it above 20 wild, how would I go about changing wilderness levels?

heres my inWild method

[code]public boolean inWild() {

if((absX > 2586 && absX < 2622 && absY > 3867 && absY < 3894) ||

	(absX > 3200 && absX < 3270 && absY > 9285 && absY < 9340) ||
	
	(absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 3518 && absY < 3966)) {
		return true;
	}
	return false;
}[/code]
